description: This Python source file defines functions related to seeding development environment users in a database, including environment variable interpretation, user existence checks, and creation of default admin and user accounts during development.

methods.name: bool _truthy_env(value: Optional[str], default: bool = False)
methods.description: Interprets environment variable values as boolean, considering common truthy strings.

methods.name: bool _should_seed_default()
methods.description: Determines default seeding behavior based on environment variables indicating development mode.

methods.name: None _ensure_user(session: AsyncSession, email: str, password: str, role: str, is_active: bool = True)
methods.description: Ensures a user exists with specified email, role, and active status; creates or updates as needed.

methods.name: None maybe_seed_dev_users()
methods.description: Main function to conditionally seed default development users based on environment variables.

ctags.name: _ensure_user
ctags.pattern: /^async def _ensure_user(session: AsyncSession, email: str, password: str, role: str, is_active: b/
ctags.signature: (session: AsyncSession, email: str, password: str, role: str, is_active: bool = True)
